name: 7 ELEVEN
note: They looking for innovative products representing categories including: - Private Brands – All Categories - Fresh Foods - Packaged Beverages - Alcoholic Beverages - Snacks & Candy - Non-Foods

name: HEB GROCERY COMPANY LP
note: 1. Supplier link form: https://supplier.heb.com/apply-v2/supplier-type 2. All companies that want to sell products or services to H-E-B must: - Comply with H-E-B’s Supplier Code of Conduct — basic ethical, social, and environmental expectations. - Have a Federal Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) — U.S. suppliers must provide this; foreign suppliers must supply a current W-8 tax certificate during setup. - Carry liability insurance — to cover legal costs or liabilities related to products/services. - Be prepared to provide additional documentation if requested by H-E-B’s qualification team. 3. Suppliers of food must follow U.S. food safety and regulatory laws, including: - Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act - Food Safety Modernization Act (FSMA) - USDA guidelines & Country of Origin Labeling - Food safety standards like produce safety, sanitary transport, preventive controls, and anti-adulteration efforts

name: WAKEFERN FOOD CORPORATION
note: Interested in establishing a vendor partnership with Wakefern? Log on to https://rangeme.com/wakefern.

name: LIDI STIFTUNG
note: - Lidl’s scale and emphasis on local sourcing (useful context). - There is a supplier info page with a contact link that we can use to start a discussion with the Lidl GB buying team on how to supply your product. - The Groceries Supply Code of Practice (GSCOP) governs how Lidl deals with suppliers, ensuring fairness and lawfulness in agreements.
